title: Mohamed Salah ankle scan reveals no serious damage following Hamza Choudhury challenge
text:
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp can breathe a sigh of relief as initial scans on Mohamed Salah’s ankle injury show no serious damage.

The Egyptian limped off in the closing stages of his side’s 2-1 victory over Leicester City on Saturday after being taken out by a ruthless challenge by Hamza Choudhury.

Choudhury was booked following the incident but Klopp was furious, saying the young midfielder needs to ‘calm down’ after being involved in several high profile late tackles recently.

But Salah was able to leave Anfield without a crutch or ankle brace, hobbling uncomfortably. And a scan on Sunday has revealed he suffered a twisted ankle rather than ligament damage.

The forward will now undergo treatment at Melwood during the international break in the hope of being available for the next Premier League game at Manchester United.

Liverpool are offering no guidance as to whether he will be fit for that fixture, but the fact he is not being ruled out is a positive sign as the club seeks to match a national record of 18 consecutive league victories.
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp can breathe a sigh of relief as initial scans on Mohamed Salah’s ankle injury show no serious damage.
